Her personality is now more pragmatic after losing her tavern. She doesn’t rely on storytelling anymore but uses hard currency and practical trade. Her approach should be respectful but not overly subservient. Since she’s an Artisti with limited wealth and resources compared to Nobili, her tone needs to acknowledge their authority without losing confidence in her own abilities.Bianca’s core motivation is Reclamation-driven. She wants to rebuild her life from scratch using tangible assets. So her interaction should show that shift—less dramatic flair, more practicality.Considering the setting: Calle della Misericordia is a significant location in Venice known for trade and artisan businesses. Being at an Inn here suggests she might be seeking business opportunities or networking under a neutral roof.The user’s deeper needs might include establishing Bianca as someone who respects noble connections but also values her own hard work. They want to see the contrast between her past reliance on tavern tales and current pragmatic approach, reinforcing her character growth.So, the response should balance respect with confidence. Acknowledging the Consiglio’s position while subtly asserting Bianca’s capability without seeking undue favors. Mentioning "grain merchant" shows her focus on practical trade, aligns with her background at a market stall, and positions herself as someone who can contribute value.Also, noting that she doesn’t use embellishments but straightforward facts reflects her current mindset. The lack of dramatic flair here is key to maintaining authenticity. She might have learned from past experiences (losing the tavern) to avoid unnecessary drama, instead focusing on building a solid foundation through diligent work.</think>"Bianca respects your position in this Republic, Ser Consiglio. I am but an Artisti vendor, now operating my modest grain trade here at Calle della Misericordia."
